item.title: Blog-post-cheatsheet
item.description: It is now two weeks since the last post - not a good start to the plan to be a little more active with social updates, progress reports and thoughts.

item.title: LinksThatMakeLifeSimpler

item.title: shucking disks
item.description: We are a week further into this year since the last post - so much for the ambitions of a post a day!

item.title: Kwangmyŏngsŏng-3; redux from an earlier comparative genomics toolbox
item.description: One of the highlights of my academic career was a simple comparative genomics platform called initially Sputnik and later openSputnik.

item.title: liva-hugo theme and some automation
item.description: In the previous post I introduced a quick exploration into the theme identified as hugo-creative-portfolio-theme.

item.title: changing themes
item.description: Yesterday’s first excursion into the blogdown universe helped prepare some basic content with the default hugo-lithium theme.

item.title: R can do anything
item.description:
Post number two! Exciting!

There has been a selection pressure to do stuff in Python. Python is the corporate language of choice; everyone else uses Python. Python even makes cups of tea. Using R is a heresy.

I have started re-invigorating some of my earlier R-projects that have since been migrated into Python. During the strange COVID-esque end-of-2020 this has been a source of pleasure. I had the desire to learn some of the Tidyverse tricks and tools - it’s wonderful! The project that was formerly called nanopoRe is currently being reinvented as floundeR and I am again finding that R is a pleasure.

item.title: It's a new year
item.description:
TL;DR - I’m in Brexile - forced to remain in Germany with family because the alternatives are far too complicated.

New Year 2021. Yay! 2020 was a massive dog’s breakfast of a year. 2021 starts with the completely unnecessary bullshit that is Brexit.
